channel.title: Item.java Problem
channel.description:
Alright, let's make this clear, I don't want to hear "search button" or "[url=http://google.com]Google[/url]" or any other crap you have to say to me. I have used -
• The search button. • [url=http://google.com]Google[/url] • [url=http://runelocus.com]Runelocus[/url] • [url=http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/board,51.0.html]RS2 Server Tutorials[/url]
When I try to add my Quest Point cape, I add it to my item.java in the correct places (hoods and capes). I then save and compile. I run the server only to see my Quest Point cape will only go into my weapon slot, and my hood will go in the cape slot! I've tried everything I can to fix it, but nothing seems to work when I try to do something with it (ex: Putting cape in "hoods" and hood in "boots"). Nothing works with my Quest Point cape! I have the right Id's set, but I cannot get them to go in the correct slot. Can someone help me with this?

item.title: Item.java Problem
item.dc:creator: @f_2_p_2_p_f f 2 p 2 p f
item.description:
@f_2_p_2_p_f wrote:

Look for the weapon in client.java and I think it has the skill level requirements to use.

Read full topic

item.title: Item.java Problem
item.dc:creator: @judgechaos judgechaos
item.description:
@judgechaos wrote:

hmmmm possible answer is…the Quest cape code is the hood code and vice versa…and were did u put the Quest hood code? on “hats” full helm" or “masks” ? if u put it on masks or full helms u need to place the code on hats first… same as body and plate body…

Read full topic
